string.text: Keeper of the "Monolith" faction. Better stay away from him. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Fighter of the "Monolith" faction. Well-equipped. Detailed information absent.
Commander of the military assault.
Military stalker. Well-armed and very dangerous. Detailed information unavailable.
Detailed information absent.
Special forces soldier. Well-armed and very dangerous. Detailed information unavailable.

Mole. The leader of the diggers at Agroprom. He unearthed the entrance to the catacombs under the institute, but didn't make it far—the military pushed him back. Now he's hiding at the factory with the remnants of his group.

The Barman. Owner of the "100 Rads" bar. Although he doesn't like being called "owner"—says "manager" fits better. A legendary personality. Established a stalker bar right under the noses of the "Duty" group base. Has connections everywhere.
Hunter. An experienced stalker who hunts mutants.
A mysterious stalker who knows a great deal. Trades information in the Bar.
One of the founders of Duty and also its chief ideologist. He developed the code of rules and recruited almost all of Duty's key members.
Head of security for Duty's territory.
Founder of the Duty faction, has been leading the faction for five years now.
No information.
Conscript Sergeant of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Detailed information absent.
Conscript Private of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Detailed information absent.
Unknown stalker. Dubious reputation. Detailed information absent.
Captain of the extended service of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Detailed information absent.
Became the leader of the rookie camp after Wolf. Determined, aggressive, and enjoys well-deserved authority among newcomers.
An old loner hardened by the Zone.
Unknown mercenary. Possibly well-armed. Detailed information absent.
A capable rookie. Enjoys the special favor of Wolf, who often sends him on important missions.

A legendary personality in his own way; they say he can guide you to any point in the Zone. He charges a lot, but it's not just about the money. He won't lead people he doesn't like for any amount. A veteran who knows the Zone inside out.
Conscript Sergeant of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Detailed information absent.
A stalker nicknamed Nimble for his ability to be unnoticed and indispensable. The trader sometimes uses him for delicate tasks: to track someone, spy on something, or eavesdrop.
Major commanding the army post at the bridge. Cooperates with stalkers, taking bribes for passage across the bridge.
Conscript Private of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Detailed information absent.
Army special forces. Well-equipped. Detailed information unavailable.
Unknown mercenary. Well-armed and very dangerous. Detailed information absent.
Rookie. Recently arrived in the Zone. Detailed information absent.
Just a stalker.
Leader of the rookie camp. An old stalker preparing for retirement.

Started trading from a young age. In kindergarten, he sold colored pencils. In school, he traded chewing gum. In college, he dealt in soft drugs. With the appearance of the Zone, he realized he could make good money here. Famous for being able to establish good trade relations with the most diverse clients.
Stalker of the "Duty" faction. Detailed information absent.
Officer of the "Duty" faction. Detailed information absent.
Rookie. Taking his first steps in the Zone.
Fled to the Zone hiding from law enforcement agencies. Alone, he tries to maintain order in the Zone as he imagines it. A fighter against lawlessness. Harsh but fair.
Rookie. Recently arrived in the Zone. Detailed information absent.
A stalker with a dirty face and an equally dirty biography.
Experienced stalker. Detailed information absent.
An informant known throughout the Zone.
Unknown mercenary. Well-armed and very dangerous. Detailed information absent.
Unknown mercenary. Apparently new to the Zone. Detailed information absent.
Unknown mercenary. Possibly well-armed. Detailed information absent.
Keeper of the "Monolith" faction. Better stay away from him. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
One of the Zone's veterans. This stalker knows the Zone like the back of his hand. Usually well-equipped and very dangerous. Detailed information absent.
Veteran stalker. Possibly well-equipped. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Freedom" faction. Commander of the Barrier. A man who rallied people around him ready to die for a common cause.
Bodyguard of "Lukash", the leader of the "Freedom" faction.
Cook of the "Freedom" faction. A drunkard and a brawler, but cooks excellently.
A mechanic known in the Zone. Can assemble a tank from a tractor.
Leader of the "Freedom" faction.
Master of the "Freedom" faction. Detailed information absent.
Keeper of the "Freedom" faction. Fanatically loyal to the faction. Excellently equipped and very dangerous. Detailed information absent.
Keeper of the "Freedom" faction. Excellently equipped and very dangerous. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Freedom" faction. Detailed information absent.
Sniper of the "Freedom" faction. Detailed information absent.
Fighter of the "Freedom" faction. Usually well-equipped. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Freedom" faction. Detailed information absent.
Known for his greed and intransigence, but they say you can get anything from him.
Stalker of the "Freedom" faction. Detailed information absent.
Fighter of the "Freedom" faction. Usually well-equipped. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Elite stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Leader of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Private stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Special forces stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Master of the "Duty" faction. Very well equipped. Detailed information absent.
Scientist. Detailed information absent.
Scientist security. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Fighter of the "Monolith" faction. Well-equipped. Detailed information absent.
Army special forces. Well-equipped. Detailed information unavailable.
One of the Zone's veterans. This stalker knows the Zone like the back of his hand. Usually well-equipped and very dangerous. Detailed information absent.
Veteran stalker. Possibly well-equipped. Detailed information absent.
Master of the "Freedom" faction. Detailed information absent.
One of the stalkers who got unlucky.
Employee of the mobile scientific laboratory. Detailed information absent.
Scientist, expert on anomalous phenomena. Worked in America on secret projects. Recently considered missing in action.

Marauder and killer. A reward has been repeatedly announced for his head. Was once on good terms with Duty, helped them capture the current territory. Now dwells in the Wild Territory and robs lone stalkers with his gang.
Doctor of Biological Sciences. Outside the Zone, he studied pathogenic mutations in animals. Went to the Zone to study mutations of blind dogs.
One of the "heroes" of the Mercenary faction. A veteran shot by all calibers. A rare psycho and sadist.
One of the field commanders of the "Mercenaries". Commander of a squad of fighters who call themselves "hounds". Anarchist, despises any laws except the law of force.
Stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the Monolith special unit - "Crystal", responsible for the safety of the Monolith itself.
Unknown stalker. Dubious reputation. Detailed information absent.
Unknown stalker. Dubious reputation. Detailed information absent.

Came to the Zone in search of adventure. Cosplays heroes of 60s comics. He is called by different names: Batman, Macho, Darkwing Duck, Banderas, and although the fact that he has been in the Zone for two years and is still alive says a lot, he is still not taken seriously, which deeply offends him.

Fierce, angry, rude, selfish, cruel, unfeeling, cold. No one knows when or how he got into the Zone. He is feared and disliked. He simply lives in the Zone; he has neither a future nor a past. After one of his numerous sorties into the Zone, he lost his memory and forgot a great deal. He doesn't remember where he is from, doesn't remember his real name, and suffers frequent memory lapses. For example, he might forget a new acquaintance an hour after meeting them, and perceiving them as an enemy, kill them.
Unknown stalker. Dubious reputation. Detailed information absent.
Unknown stalker. Dubious reputation. Detailed information absent.
Keeper of the "Duty" faction. If you are not their friend, you better avoid them. Detailed information unavailable.
Stalker of the "Duty" faction. Detailed information absent.
Fighter of the "Duty" faction. Usually well-equipped. Detailed information absent.

Boor, sycophant, hypocrite, coward. Barin's life credo could be called the phrase "after us, the flood." Tries to extract benefit from everything. At the same time, he is very ambitious and touchy. He came to the Zone, as banal as it sounds, for money. And for the second year in the Zone, he has been engaged in obtaining material values by any means.
Fighter of the "Duty" faction. Usually well-equipped. Detailed information absent.

He is an official SBU recruiter. Often sits in the bar. Everyone knows about this, and also that if things get too tight, you should go to him. True, after this step, the way back to honest stalkers will be closed.

In everyday life, he is phlegmatic, does not express his emotions, calm. However, under strong impressions, he is quick-tempered and aggressive. An intellectual. A materialist, terribly regrets ending up in the Zone. After graduating from medical school, he was sent to the Zone, where the scientist camp needed a neurosurgeon assistant. He dissects mutant brains and researches their psychokinetic abilities. Waits for retirement and the opportunity to live in the capital away from this godforsaken place.
One of the stalkers who got unlucky.
Unknown mercenary. Possibly well-armed. Detailed information absent.
Unknown mercenary. Possibly well-armed. Detailed information absent.
Unknown mercenary. Possibly well-armed. Detailed information absent.
Unknown mercenary. Possibly well-armed. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Detailed information absent.
Military stalker. Well-armed and very dangerous. Detailed information unavailable.
Private soldier. Detailed information absent.
Detailed information absent.
Army special forces. Well-equipped. Detailed information unavailable.
Experienced stalker. Detailed information absent.

Incredibly lucky stalker. Many times his group was on the brink of death, and he was always the only one who managed to survive. He has a bad reputation among stalkers as an "unlucky talisman". For some time now, he walks alone.
One of the Zone's veterans. This stalker knows the Zone like the back of his hand. Usually well-equipped and very dangerous. Detailed information absent.

A smuggler with experience. For a long time, he traded in Africa and South America. Stories about Chernobyl mutants that went around the world brought him to Ukraine. In a short period, he managed to export several hundred stuffed mutants from the exclusion zone, for which he received the nickname "Scarecrow" (Chuchelo). Between "work" in the Zone, he is a successful merchant. Loves Armani suits and Versace ties, but prefers Soviet guns.

Former Afghan vet. During one of the mujahideen ambushes, he suddenly found faith in God. After Afghanistan, he immigrated to Poland, where he entered a theological seminary. After graduating, he preached for some time in the Lviv Catholic Church. After the explosion at the Chernobyl NPP, he signed up as a volunteer to help the victims. For the last few years, he has been preaching on the territory of the Zone.

In the past, a fitter from the "KholodMash" plant. After his wife left him, he decided to commit suicide, and since he was a religious man, he chose the Zone as an original way of suicide. But he survived, got accustomed over a couple of years, and gained certain authority among stalkers thanks to his professional skills. At the moment, Master is the most competent fitter in the Zone; repair of equipment and machinery, arrangement of protection systems for faction bunkers, etc., is his diocese. Welcome everywhere, influential, simple but rough in communication.

Former military stalker, Lieutenant Colonel of the internal troops. After one operation deep in the Zone, he remained the only one left from the entire squad, but found evidence that they were simply set up, sent to slaughter. After that, he decided not to return, faked his own death, and joined the stalkers to deal with the Zone's problem illegally. Taciturn, cynical, purposeful.
Rookie. Recently arrived in the Zone. Detailed information absent.

Neumeha is 20 years old. He had nothing and no one left on the mainland, so he decided to come here. He simply has nowhere to go from the Zone. In the Zone, he barely makes ends meet. He owes some money to very many stalkers. He goes into the Zone very often, but never alone; usually, he latches onto groups of stalkers. But few agree to take him, as he is just an extra burden. He collects loot very rarely. Lives on handouts from other stalkers and is therefore deep in debt.
Veteran stalker. Possibly well-equipped. Detailed information absent.
Veteran stalker. Possibly well-equipped. Detailed information absent.

Oleg "Demon" Gusarov. Former "Black Beret", served in the Bila Tserkva Spetsnaz Brigade. Extended service, Senior Sergeant, specialty sniper and demolitionist. By state of soul - a "lone wolf". Never takes partners with him into the Zone, preferring to act alone. He was repeatedly offered to join clans - always refused point-blank for this very reason.

Physics student, left his fifth year of university for the Zone to earn money. Loves to show off his "scientific" knowledge and discourse on abstract philosophical topics. Stalkers dislike him for this showing off. But overall, a not bad guy. Still believes in high ideals.

Sparrow is 27. Cunning, foresightful, but sometimes makes gross mistakes. At times mean. Overall, leaves a dual impression. Thin and pale. Came to the Zone out of curiosity and promised himself - two months in the Zone - and home. But he stayed here. In his first sortie into the Zone, he managed to walk without devices through a field completely strewn with anomalies, not knowing about them. When he was told about this, he couldn't recover for a long time. Since then, he celebrates that day (October 9) as his second birthday.
Master of the "Freedom" faction. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Freedom" faction. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Freedom" faction. Detailed information absent.
Fighter of the "Freedom" faction. Usually well-equipped. Detailed information absent.

Leshiy (Wood Goblin), as his brother nicknamed him, came to the Zone as a young idealist. But several years of living by a thread from death made him a cynical realist. Considers the Zone his home, and those who haven't passed the Zone's test - unworthy of living on Earth.
Writes essays and stories about the Zone under the pseudonym Arkady. In the past a journalist, meticulous, tough, but fair. Enjoys certain respect among stalkers.
One of the stalkers who got unlucky.
One of the stalkers who got unlucky.
One of the stalkers who got unlucky.
Bandit bodyguard. Dubious reputation. Detailed information absent.
Private bandit. Dubious reputation. Detailed information absent.
Novice bandit. Dubious reputation. Detailed information absent.
Experienced bandit. Dubious reputation. Detailed information absent.
Leader of the bandits.
Stalker of the "Duty" faction. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Monolith" faction. Detailed information absent.
Stalker of the "Duty" faction. Detailed information absent.
Private soldier. Detailed information absent.
Army special forces. Well-equipped. Detailed information unavailable.
Experienced stalker. Detailed information absent.
Rookie. Recently arrived in the Zone. Detailed information absent.
Veteran of Zone research. Participated in the first expeditions of 2007.
Scientific researcher of the mobile laboratory. Detailed information absent.
